Comment: Trump: "Chaos, uncertainty, and brain dead economic policies all around!"   China: "I love that for you! Let me help..."  Seriously, China is jonesing to take over as world economic superpower. That's why they've been expanding influence with their "Belt and Road" initiative. Now that Trump has cut USAID, there's a huge leadership gap to fill, and they're bound to jump at that chance. All the Canadians we've threatened to invade, all the Europeans we've abandoned in helping Ukraine (and let's consider the very real possibility that we abandon NATO on the whole), they're going to be looking for reliable trading partners. Hopefully they'll work out deals with each other and strengthen ties between democratic nations, but a lot of the gap, I imagine, will be filled by China.  Trump can limit some of the damage by decreasing tariffs, but I think a lot of the damage done is long-term at this point.

LOL" ten days later, that has equal meaning. So for many businesses and investors, yes this is news.

Comment: But this isn’t the same thing. Apples and oranges.   If he says tariff is now X, then yes that is a real substantial change that has immediate ramifications.   If he says “they should fire this guy”, “oh tariffs will come down”, or what ever else, it’s just fluff. His words don’t mean anything until action takes place.
